column1: Kata Robata////We went to Kata Robata for Houston Restaurant Week
column2: after a co-worker raved about the place. Dinner started out well
column3: the agedashi tofu and pork belly salad were both excellent. For entrée
column4: I ordered the Sushi & Roll Plate while my husband ordered the Grilled 72 hours TX Kobe Beef. I am not sure if the portions were reduced significantly because of HRW
column5: but my husband's ENTRÉE consisted of 4-5 small (and I mean really small) cubes of beef and another 4-5 bite-sized pieces of potato. Seriously
column6: for entrée? Really?? To add insult to injury
column7: the Kobe beef itself did not live up to expectations in terms of tenderness or flavor.
